DOC.brief_summary: The study evaluates respiratory acclimatization in healthy lowlanders staying for 3 weeks at 3200 m.
DOC.brief_title: Acclimatization of Healthy Subjects During a Stay at 3200 m
DOC.detailed_description: This study evaluates the effect of 3 weeks altitude acclimatization on sleep related breathing disturbances in healthy subjects staying at 3200 m. Participants living in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan (700 m), will be transferred by car within 4 h to the Tuja Ashu high altitude clinic (3200 m). Outcomes will be assessed repeatedly during the stay at 3200 m.
DOC.criteria: Perfect health Born, raised and currently living at low altitude (<800m) Informed consent. Any acute or chronic disease heavy smoking (>20 cigarettes per day).
